reviews.review_msg: Diana is super caring and a great lecturer. Fair exams and quizzes. However, the projects dented my grade, which is disappointing considering how much work/time I put into them. By part 3 of the assignment, I was super stressed and gave up. My grade was in the A range before the project and now I'm at B+...so my efforts feel a bit wasted.

I've taken several of Diana's classes and have enjoyed them. I particularly enjoyed her teaching 340. She does have a voice that puts you to sleep at 8:30a, but she's good at breaking lectures up into group activities that are related to the final. Can be a difficult grader, exams based on lectures and readings. Really well presented OL courses.

Prof Bedoya is an amazing lecturer. She makes 3 hour lectures at 8:30am something to look forward to. You can tell she is really passionate about her courses and wants her students to do well. She is funny, and loves to engage with the class. This is my second course with her and I can't wait to take another one with her.

Had her for 2 classes before 340 and I was very pleased. This semester, beyond disappointed. Prematurely releases final grades. Does not respond to important emails. Heck, doesnt even let you see your exam mark, let alone the mark breakdown. This prof and TA combo was atrocious. Worst of my 4 year sfu experience.

Im not one to leave a review, but the structure of this course was not conducive to success. The marking of assignments and quizzes was unlike any upper division Ive completed. Simply did not make sense a lot of the time, yet the TA and professor would reconsider nothing. The rubrics were rendered useless, as was every piece of feedback.

Certainly not a GPA booster. She was very effective at teaching lower division courses, as well as BPK 325, but this class was brutal. Marking was unreasonably tough. Feedback was not insightful, nor helpful. The lectures do not equip you with the skills needed to excel. Trust me, an A in this course is far fetched.

Marks were taken off on assignments that met all the criteria for no reason other than that the TA didn't personally vibe with it. Diana is a very nice prof but her lectures don't explain the concepts super well and it felt impossible to get a good grade. My gpa is like over 4.00 but i still suffered. She is good for bpk110 but bad for bpk340.

I'm rating the difficulty based on how much work and precision is required for an A. The TA provided the least helpful feedback I've ever received. 2 of 3 assignments had a rubric, however, the marking scheme was far from clear. Adhering to the instructions/rubric will get you a B. Your ideas must be revolutionary to receive an A. Woudnt recommend

I think SFU should get a new professor. She has zero care for students and doesn't reply to my emails. The quizzes and assignments are marked a lot harder than it should be and she refuses to change the marks when they are marked wrong. Her conduct towards students is plain disrespectful... she shouldn't be a prof.

This prof doesn't teach. It feels like she's taken the pandemic as an opportunity to load more stress on the students. The course itself isn't horrible and should be easy, but Diana makes it unbearable. I recommend the course if you're looking for an easy course but just avoid Diana Bedoya at all costs. She's beyond awful

Would not recommend the remote version of this course. Layout consists of 3 very subjective assignments. You can hit all the notes on the rubric and still receive a 75% with no explanation of why or how. Syllabus is deceiving. Looks straightforward but the expectations are held at perfection. Material is dry and grades will be scaled down. Not fun

This semester I've had tough classes, and BPK 340 wasn't supposed to be one of them. However, Diana made the class unbearable! She doesn't reply to emails. Quizzes are so difficult & timed. Feedback on the quizzes is useless. She is rude & doesn't care about the well-being of her students. I regret everyday taking this class with her. AVOID DIANA!

The professor has no respect for her students, she doesn't reply to the emails either and she expects an unrealistic amount of knowledge in order to be able to do well on the exam. Marking criteria is vague and what she says in lecture contradicts some correct answers on exam, which makes it hard to do well. Overall, I would not recommend at all.

Beyond horrible at teaching. Has crazy, unrealistic expectations from students, doesn't reply to emails. Felt like she wanted to teach the course so she could take the opportunity to stress students out. Run far far away from her. Absolutely horrible

Terrible prof. Expects us to memorize over 10 pages of readings (each of them like 13 pages) in addition to lectures (50+ slides per lecture). 340 was supposed to be an easy course, but Diana made it unnecessarily difficult and added an unnecessary amount of stress on the students during an already tough time. DO NOT take any courses with her

Enjoyed her style of teaching and the class was fun overall. Easy A if you put in the work. However, her grading criteria can be really vague and hard to go off of when doing assignments. No midterm, easy bi-weekly quizzes if you do the study questions. Final was harder than quizzes, but had similar questions, and asked to design a questionnaire.

Unbelievable guy. If you pay attention and really conceptualize the class, it is easy and is very interesting to everyday life. This isn't a kickback class, but it is also not super difficult. Take your time on assignments and start early. Stephen is a very fair and respected guy. Very positive experience being taught by him.

His marking scheme is super subjective and course material is overall irrelevant to the field. Sure he's a nice guy but his slides are poorly presented and the "textbook" is full of errors. Basically a course where you memorize lists that won't help you in the future.
good thing this senile man is retiring, marks way too hard, not fair at all, dissapear stephen

His book is poorly written. Typos, lack of knowledge of the millennial era, irrelevant information, and he paraphrases articles so poorly that I'd rather just read the article it self. Lectures are almost a joke. Goes over like 10 slides in 2.5 hours. Take out the stretches and one break,  we'd be gone in 2 hours max including in class activity.

Honestly, the most enjoyable class you'll take in BPK upper division. This class is hilarious and you also learn quite a bit.  Stephen Brown does an awesome job keeping the class engaged and is very fair with grades. Take it with him!

His class is quite easy and even though its 3hrs long, he usually ends it in one and a half hours. He doesn't teach much in class so you really need the textbook for the concept and because the questions are right from the textbook. He also takes stretch breaks every few minutes too so it's never really boring. It's the only class I never slept in.

Peter sets a true example for a scholar, and inspires you to be better in every aspect of your life. The design of the course was fair and allowed students to take charge of their learning. There's a big focus on group work, and there isn't excessive direction given for the assignments. They allow you to show creativity. Amazing!!!
